message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.SD, cs.AI. 

The paper discusses the application of topic modelling techniques to speech transcripts and OCR output, which are both related to natural language processing (NLP) and information retrieval (IR), suggesting that cs.CL and cs.IR are likely sub-categories. The paper also discusses the effects of textual noise on topic stability, which is related to machine learning (ML) and data mining, suggesting that cs.LG and cs.SD are also possible sub-categories. Finally, the paper proposes guidelines for text corpus generation and topic model selection, which are related to AI and ML, suggesting that cs.AI is also a possible sub-category.
